channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump and Fed chairman clash over renovation site cost. And, Gaza peace talks stalled
item.description: Trump and Fed Chairman Jerome Powell clashed over the cost of renovations to the Federal Reserve headquarters. And, ceasefire talks between Israel and Hamas stalled yesterday.
item.content:encoded:
Trump and Fed Chairman Jerome Powell clashed over the cost of renovations to the Federal Reserve headquarters. And, ceasefire talks between Israel and Hamas stalled yesterday.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: People like extroverted robots — but they relate to the neurotic ones
item.description: Neurotic personalities are a staple of science fiction. Researchers who study how people react to robot personalities have recently found that neurotic traits in a robot can make them seem more relatable.
item.content:encoded:
Neurotic personalities are a staple of science fiction. Researchers who study how people react to robot personalities have recently found that neurotic traits in a robot can make them seem more relatable.

(Image credit: Gregory_DUBUS)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Who or what is Trump's "beautiful baby?" Find out in the quiz
item.description: Plus, what are Tesla and Coca-Cola up to? And RIP Ozzy Osbourne and Hulk Hogan.
item.content:encoded: Plus, what are Tesla and Coca-Cola up to? And RIP Ozzy Osbourne and Hulk Hogan.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: Fearing coverage could change, some parents rush to vaccinate their kids
item.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is changing how federal agencies handle vaccine recommendations. Some parents are hurrying to get kids their shots, fearing future changes could limit access.
item.content:encoded:
Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is changing how federal agencies handle vaccine recommendations. Some parents are hurrying to get kids their shots, fearing future changes could limit access.

(Image credit: Jan Sonnenmair)
item.dc:creator: Jackie Fortiér

item.title: Making a living as a poker player is hard. The 'Big Beautiful Bill' makes it harder
item.description: A new law includes a provision that could mean bettors pay more during tax season. Major poker players are calling on Congress to royally flush the measure down the drain.
item.content:encoded:
A new law includes a provision that could mean bettors pay more during tax season. Major poker players are calling on Congress to royally flush the measure down the drain.

(Image credit: Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Hit the road, Jack! Lumberjills chip their way into timber sports
item.description: 'Lumberjills' chip away at Paul Bunyon stereotypes at the 65th annual Lumberjack Championship, with more women than ever before competing in the Hayward, Wisconsin, event.
item.content:encoded:
'Lumberjills' chip away at Paul Bunyon stereotypes at the 65th annual Lumberjack Championship, with more women than ever before competing in the Hayward, Wisconsin, event.

(Image credit: Maayan Silver)
item.dc:creator: Maayan Silver

item.title: Trump voters wanted lower medical bills. But for millions, bills are about to go up
item.description: Moves by the Trump administration to pare back Medicaid, rescind medical debt rules and loosen vaccine requirements threaten to increase medical bills for millions of Americans.
item.content:encoded:
Moves by the Trump administration to pare back Medicaid, rescind medical debt rules and loosen vaccine requirements threaten to increase medical bills for millions of Americans.

(Image credit: DNY59)
item.dc:creator: Noam Levey

item.title: How and why Trump has struggled in dealing with the Epstein files
item.description: The usual deflection tactics — releasing unrelated information, blaming Democrats and the media — haven't worked with this controversy.
item.content:encoded:
The usual deflection tactics — releasing unrelated information, blaming Democrats and the media — haven't worked with this controversy.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: What we know about Columbia's $221 million settlement with the Trump administration
item.description: The complex settlement allowed both sides to claim victory. It gives the university access to federal funds that had been frozen, and restores some terminated contracts.
item.content:encoded:
The complex settlement allowed both sides to claim victory. It gives the university access to federal funds that had been frozen, and restores some terminated contracts.

(Image credit: Charly Triballeau)
item.dc:creator: Elissa Nadworny

item.title: Warning labels on menopause treatments 'scare women,' doctors tell the FDA
item.description: The FDA may remove the warning labels on hormone replacement therapies used to treat the symptoms of menopause. Doctors say the warning is scaring people who could benefit from these treatments.
item.content:encoded:
The FDA may remove the warning labels on hormone replacement therapies used to treat the symptoms of menopause. Doctors say the warning is scaring people who could benefit from these treatments.

(Image credit: MStudioImages)
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle
